body_html:
In general, the feature in question would be graph rewiring: being able to replace a node with another node in a computation graph, after the fact. The most common use case would be to build a graph on top of placeholders, then replace the placeholders with ops that yield data (e.g. TF pipelines, TFRecords, etc). Graph editing.

I don't believe this is currently possible. It would certainly be useful.

body:
In general, the feature in question would be graph rewiring: being able to replace a node with another node in a computation graph, after the fact. The most common use case would be to build a graph on top of placeholders, then replace the placeholders with ops that yield data (e.g. TF pipelines, TFRecords, etc). Graph editing.

I don't believe this is currently possible. It would certainly be useful.
